marker.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

args2.description:
array
Sets a 2nd set of `args`, these arguments values are passed to the Plotly method set in `method` when clicking this button while in the active state. Use this to create toggle buttons.
args2.title: Args2

args.description:
array
Sets the arguments values to be passed to the Plotly method set in `method` on click.
args.title: Args

execute.description:
boolean
When true, the API method is executed. When false, all other behaviors are the same and command execution is skipped. This may be useful when hooking into, for example, the `plotly_buttonclicked` method and executing the API command manually without losing the benefit of the updatemenu automatically binding to the state of the plot through the specification of `method` and `args`.
execute.title: Execute

label.description:
string
Sets the text label to appear on the button.
label.title: Label

method.description:
enumerated , one of ( "restyle" | "relayout" | "animate" | "update" | "skip" )
Sets the Plotly method to be called on click. If the `skip` method is used, the API updatemenu will function as normal but will perform no API calls and will not bind automatically to state updates. This may be used to create a component interface and attach to updatemenu events manually via JavaScript.
method.title: Method

name.description:
string
When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template.
name.title: Name

templateitemname.description:
string
Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.
templateitemname.title: Templateitemname

visible.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not this button is visible.
visible.title: Visible

count.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the number of steps to take to update the range. Use with `step` to specify the update interval.
count.title: Count

label.description:
string
Sets the text label to appear on the button.
label.title: Label

name.description:
string
When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template.
name.title: Name

step.description:
enumerated , one of ( "month" | "year" | "day" | "hour" | "minute" | "second" | "all" )
The unit of measurement that the `count` value will set the range by.
step.title: Step

stepmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "backward" | "todate" )
Sets the range update mode. If "backward", the range update shifts the start of range back "count" times "step" milliseconds. If "todate", the range update shifts the start of range back to the first timestamp from "count" times "step" milliseconds back. For example, with `step` set to "year" and `count` set to "1" the range update shifts the start of the range back to January 01 of the current year. Month and year "todate" are currently available only for the built-in (Gregorian) calendar.
stepmode.title: Stepmode

templateitemname.description:
string
Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.
templateitemname.title: Templateitemname

visible.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not this button is visible.
visible.title: Visible

customdata.description:
data array
Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, "scatter" traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements
customdata.title: Customdata

decreasing.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

hoverinfo.description:
flaglist string. any combination of "x", "y", "z", "text", "name" joined with a "+" or "all" or "none" or "skip".
Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.
hoverinfo.title: Hoverinfo

hoverlabel.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

hovertext.description:
string or array of strings
Same as `text`.
hovertext.title: Hovertext

ids.description:
data array
Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.
ids.title: Ids

increasing.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

legendgroup.description:
string
Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.
legendgroup.title: Legendgroup

legendgrouptitle.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

legendrank.description:
number
Sets the legend rank for this trace. Items and groups with smaller ranks are presented on top/left side while with `"reversed" `legend.traceorder` they are on bottom/right side. The default legendrank is 1000, so that you can use ranks less than 1000 to place certain items before all unranked items, and ranks greater than 1000 to go after all unranked items.
legendrank.title: Legendrank

legendwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px or fraction) of the legend for this trace.
legendwidth.title: Legendwidth

line.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

meta.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.
meta.title: Meta

opacity.description:
number between or equal to 0 and 1
Sets the opacity of the trace.
opacity.title: Opacity

selectedpoints.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.
selectedpoints.title: Selectedpoints

showlegend.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.
showlegend.title: Showlegend

text.description:
string or array of strings
Sets hover text elements associated with each sample point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to this trace's sample points.
text.title: Text

uirevision.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.
uirevision.title: Uirevision

visible.description:
enumerated , one of ( true | false | "legendonly" )
Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If "legendonly", the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).
visible.title: Visible

whiskerwidth.description:
number between or equal to 0 and 1
Sets the width of the whiskers relative to the box' width. For example, with 1, the whiskers are as wide as the box(es).
whiskerwidth.title: Whiskerwidth

x.description:
data array
Sets the x coordinates. If absent, linear coordinate will be generated.
x.title: X

xaxis.description:
subplotid
Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If "x" (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If "x2", the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.
xaxis.title: Xaxis

xcalendar.description:
enumerated , one of ( "chinese" | "coptic" | "discworld" | "ethiopian" | "gregorian" | "hebrew" | "islamic" | "jalali" | "julian" | "mayan" | "nanakshahi" | "nepali" | "persian" | "taiwan" | "thai" | "ummalqura" )
Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data.
xcalendar.title: Xcalendar

xhoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `x` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"By default the values are formatted using `xaxis.hoverformat`.
xhoverformat.title: Xhoverformat

xperiod0.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Only relevant when the axis `type` is "date". Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the x0 axis. When `x0period` is round number of weeks, the `x0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.
xperiod0.title: Xperiod0

xperiod.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Only relevant when the axis `type` is "date". Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or "M" on the x axis. Special values in the form of "M" could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.
xperiod.title: Xperiod

xperiodalignment.description:
enumerated , one of ( "start" | "middle" | "end" )
Only relevant when the axis `type` is "date". Sets the alignment of data points on the x axis.
xperiodalignment.title: Xperiodalignment

yaxis.description:
subplotid
Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If "y" (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If "y2", the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.
yaxis.title: Yaxis

yhoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `y` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"By default the values are formatted using `yaxis.hoverformat`.
yhoverformat.title: Yhoverformat

autotypenumbers.description:
enumerated , one of ( "convert types" | "strict" )
Using "strict" a numeric string in trace data is not converted to a number. Using "convert types" a numeric string in trace data may be treated as a number during automatic axis `type` detection. Defaults to layout.autotypenumbers.
autotypenumbers.title: Autotypenumbers

categoryarray.description:
data array
Sets the order in which categories on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to "array". Used with `categoryorder`.
categoryarray.title: Categoryarray

categoryorder.description:
enumerated , one of ( "trace" | "category ascending" | "category descending" | "array" )
Specifies the ordering logic for the case of categorical variables. By default, plotly uses "trace", which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to "category ascending" or "category descending" if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to "array" to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the "trace" mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`.
categoryorder.title: Categoryorder

color.description:
color
Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this.
color.title: Color

dtick.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
The stride between grid lines along the axis
dtick.title: Dtick

endline.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not a line is drawn at along the final value of this axis. If "true", the end line is drawn on top of the grid lines.
endline.title: Endline

endlinecolor.description:
color
Sets the line color of the end line.
endlinecolor.title: Endlinecolor

endlinewidth.description:
number
Sets the width (in px) of the end line.
endlinewidth.title: Endlinewidth

exponentformat.description:
enumerated , one of ( "none" | "e" | "e" | "power" | "si" | "b" )
Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If "none", it appears as 1,000,000,000. If "e", 1e+9. If "E", 1E+9. If "power", 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If "SI", 1G. If "B", 1B.
exponentformat.title: Exponentformat

fixedrange.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not this axis is zoom-able. If true, then zoom is disabled.
fixedrange.title: Fixedrange

griddash.description:
string
Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string ("solid", "dot", "dash", "longdash", "dashdot", or "longdashdot") or a dash length list in px (eg "5px,10px,2px,2px").
griddash.title: Griddash

gridwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.
gridwidth.title: Gridwidth

labelpadding.description:
integer
Extra padding between label and the axis
labelpadding.title: Labelpadding

linewidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.
linewidth.title: Linewidth

minexponent.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number
minexponent.title: Minexponent

minorgridcolor.description:
color
Sets the color of the grid lines.
minorgridcolor.title: Minorgridcolor

minorgridcount.description:
integer greater than or equal to 0
Sets the number of minor grid ticks per major grid tick
minorgridcount.title: Minorgridcount

minorgriddash.description:
string
Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string ("solid", "dot", "dash", "longdash", "dashdot", or "longdashdot") or a dash length list in px (eg "5px,10px,2px,2px").
minorgriddash.title: Minorgriddash

minorgridwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines.
minorgridwidth.title: Minorgridwidth

nticks.description:
integer greater than or equal to 0
Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to "auto".
nticks.title: Nticks

range.description:
array
Sets the range of this axis. If the axis `type` is "log", then you must take the log of your desired range (e.g. to set the range from 1 to 100, set the range from 0 to 2). If the axis `type` is "date", it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. If the axis `type` is "category", it should be numbers, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.
range.title: Range

rangemode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "normal" | "tozero" | "nonnegative" )
If "normal", the range is computed in relation to the extrema of the input data. If "tozero"`, the range extends to 0, regardless of the input data If "nonnegative", the range is non-negative, regardless of the input data.
rangemode.title: Rangemode

showexponent.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
If "all", all exponents are shown besides their significands. If "first", only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If "last", only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If "none", no exponents appear.
showexponent.title: Showexponent

showgrid.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If "true", the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark.
showgrid.title: Showgrid

showline.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn.
showline.title: Showline

showticklabels.description:
enumerated , one of ( "start" | "end" | "both" | "none" )
Determines whether axis labels are drawn on the low side, the high side, both, or neither side of the axis.
showticklabels.title: Showticklabels

showtickprefix.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
If "all", all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If "first", only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If "last", only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If "none", tick prefixes are hidden.
showtickprefix.title: Showtickprefix

showticksuffix.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.
showticksuffix.title: Showticksuffix

smoothing.description: number between or equal to 0 and 1.3
smoothing.title: Smoothing

startline.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not a line is drawn at along the starting value of this axis. If "true", the start line is drawn on top of the grid lines.
startline.title: Startline

startlinecolor.description:
color
Sets the line color of the start line.
startlinecolor.title: Startlinecolor

startlinewidth.description:
number
Sets the width (in px) of the start line.
startlinewidth.title: Startlinewidth

tick0.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
The starting index of grid lines along the axis
tick0.title: Tick0

tickangle.description:
angle
Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.
tickangle.title: Tickangle

tickfont.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets the tick font.

tickformat.description:
string
Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"
tickformat.title: Tickformat

tickformatstops.description: array of object where each object has one or more of the keys listed below.
tickformatstops.title: Tickformatstops

tickmode.description: enumerated , one of ( "linear" | "array" )
tickmode.title: Tickmode

ticktext.description:
data array
Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to "array". Used with `tickvals`.
ticktext.title: Ticktext

tickvals.description:

Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to "array". Used with `ticktext`.
tickvals.title: Tickvals

object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets this legend group's title font.

Chart.description:
Charts are used to house traces and set up layout configurations (titles, axis labels, ect.).

A chart contains 1 to many traces. This is really useful if you want to combine traces that are on different date grains, bars and lines, or even overlay big numbers over line chart to show the current value and the trend.

The layout is where you define static labels like titles but also where you can set interactive elements like buttons and drop downs. With those interactive elements you can toggle between traces or cohorts on traces.
``` yaml
chart:
  name: a-chart-name
  traces:
    - ref(a-trace-name)
  layout:
    title: 'Aggregated Fibonacci'
    yaxis:
      title: 'Widgets Sold' #Describe the data in your y axis
    xaxis:
      title: 'Week' #Describe the data in your x axis
    stack: False
```

name.description: The unique name of the object across the entire project.
name.title: Name

traces.description: A list of trace either written in line in the chart called using the ref() function.
traces.title: Traces

layout.description: The layout attribute of the chart accepts any valid plotly layout configurations.

Chart.title: Chart

autocolorscale.description:
boolean
Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.
autocolorscale.title: Autocolorscale

coloraxis.description:
subplotid
Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are "coloraxis", "coloraxis2", "coloraxis3", etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.
coloraxis.title: Coloraxis

colorbar.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

colorscale.description:
colorscale
Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use `zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Blackbody,Bluered,Blues,Cividis,Earth,Electric,Greens,Greys,Hot,Jet,Picnic,Portland,Rainbow,RdBu,Reds,Viridis,YlGnBu,YlOrRd.
colorscale.title: Colorscale

customdata.description:
data array
Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, "scatter" traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements
customdata.title: Customdata

featureidkey.description:
string
Sets the key in GeoJSON features which is used as id to match the items included in the `locations` array. Only has an effect when `geojson` is set. Support nested property, for example "properties.name".
featureidkey.title: Featureidkey

geo.description:
subplotid
Sets a reference between this trace's geospatial coordinates and a geographic map. If "geo" (the default value), the geospatial coordinates refer to `layout.geo`. If "geo2", the geospatial coordinates refer to `layout.geo2`, and so on.
geo.title: Geo

geojson.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Sets optional GeoJSON data associated with this trace. If not given, the features on the base map are used. It can be set as a valid GeoJSON object or as a URL string. Note that we only accept GeoJSONs of type "FeatureCollection" or "Feature" with geometries of type "Polygon" or "MultiPolygon".
geojson.title: Geojson

hoverinfo.description:
flaglist string. any combination of "location", "z", "text", "name" joined with a "+" or "all" or "none" or "skip".
Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.
hoverinfo.title: Hoverinfo

hoverlabel.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

hovertemplate.description:
string or array of strings
Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}" as well as %{xother}, {%_xother}, {%_xother_}, {%xother_}. When showing info for several points, "xother" will be added to those with different x positions from the first point. An underscore before or after "(x|y)other" will add a space on that side, only when this field is shown. Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "{fullData.name}". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag ``.
hovertemplate.title: Hovertemplate

hovertext.description:
string or array of strings
Same as `text`.
hovertext.title: Hovertext

ids.description:
data array
Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.
ids.title: Ids

legendgroup.description:
string
Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.
legendgroup.title: Legendgroup

legendgrouptitle.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

legendrank.description:
number
Sets the legend rank for this trace. Items and groups with smaller ranks are presented on top/left side while with `"reversed" `legend.traceorder` they are on bottom/right side. The default legendrank is 1000, so that you can use ranks less than 1000 to place certain items before all unranked items, and ranks greater than 1000 to go after all unranked items.
legendrank.title: Legendrank

legendwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px or fraction) of the legend for this trace.
legendwidth.title: Legendwidth

locationmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "iso-3" | "usa-states" | "country names" | "geojson-id" )
Determines the set of locations used to match entries in `locations` to regions on the map. Values "ISO-3", "USA-states", "country names" correspond to features on the base map and value "geojson-id" corresponds to features from a custom GeoJSON linked to the `geojson` attribute.
locationmode.title: Locationmode

locations.description:
data array
Sets the coordinates via location IDs or names. See `locationmode` for more info.
locations.title: Locations

marker.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

meta.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.
meta.title: Meta

reversescale.description:
boolean
Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.
reversescale.title: Reversescale

selected.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

selectedpoints.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.
selectedpoints.title: Selectedpoints

showlegend.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.
showlegend.title: Showlegend

showscale.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.
showscale.title: Showscale

text.description:
string or array of strings
Sets the text elements associated with each location.
text.title: Text

uirevision.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.
uirevision.title: Uirevision

unselected.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

visible.description:
enumerated , one of ( true | false | "legendonly" )
Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If "legendonly", the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).
visible.title: Visible

z.description:
data array
Sets the color values.
z.title: Z

zauto.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax` Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.
zauto.title: Zauto

zmax.description:
number
Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.
zmax.title: Zmax

zmid.description:
number
Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.
zmid.title: Zmid

zmin.description:
number
Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.
zmin.title: Zmin

bgcolor.description:
color
Sets the color of padded area.
bgcolor.title: Bgcolor

bordercolor.description:
color
Sets the axis line color.
bordercolor.title: Bordercolor

borderwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar.
borderwidth.title: Borderwidth

dtick.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to "log" and "date" axes. If the axis `type` is "log", then ticks are set every 10^(n"dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. "log" has several special values; "L", where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = "L0.5" will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use "D1" (all digits) or "D2" (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for "D1" and "D2". If the axis `type` is "date", then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. "date" also has special values "M" gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to "2000-01-15" and `dtick` to "M3". To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to "M48"
dtick.title: Dtick

exponentformat.description:
enumerated , one of ( "none" | "e" | "e" | "power" | "si" | "b" )
Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If "none", it appears as 1,000,000,000. If "e", 1e+9. If "E", 1E+9. If "power", 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If "SI", 1G. If "B", 1B.
exponentformat.title: Exponentformat

len.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends.
len.title: Len

lenmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "fraction" | "pixels" )
Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot "fraction" or in "pixels. Use `len` to set the value.
lenmode.title: Lenmode

minexponent.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is "SI" or "B".
minexponent.title: Minexponent

nticks.description:
integer greater than or equal to 0
Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to "auto".
nticks.title: Nticks

orientation.description:
enumerated , one of ( "h" | "v" )
Sets the orientation of the colorbar.
orientation.title: Orientation

outlinewidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.
outlinewidth.title: Outlinewidth

showexponent.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
If "all", all exponents are shown besides their significands. If "first", only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If "last", only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If "none", no exponents appear.
showexponent.title: Showexponent

showticklabels.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.
showticklabels.title: Showticklabels

showtickprefix.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
If "all", all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If "first", only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If "last", only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If "none", tick prefixes are hidden.
showtickprefix.title: Showtickprefix

showticksuffix.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.
showticksuffix.title: Showticksuffix

thickness.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels.
thickness.title: Thickness

thicknessmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "fraction" | "pixels" )
Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot "fraction" or in "pixels". Use `thickness` to set the value.
thicknessmode.title: Thicknessmode

tick0.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is "log", then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`="L" (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is "date", it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is "category", it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.
tick0.title: Tick0

tickangle.description:
angle
Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.
tickangle.title: Tickangle

tickfont.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets the color bar's tick label font

tickformat.description:
string
Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"
tickformat.title: Tickformat

tickformatstops.description: array of object where each object has one or more of the keys listed below.
tickformatstops.title: Tickformatstops

ticklabeloverflow.description:
enumerated , one of ( "allow" | "hide past div" | "hide past domain" )
Determines how we handle tick labels that would overflow either the graph div or the domain of the axis. The default value for inside tick labels is "hide past domain". In other cases the default is "hide past div".
ticklabeloverflow.title: Ticklabeloverflow

ticklabelposition.description:
enumerated , one of ( "outside" | "inside" | "outside top" | "inside top" | "outside left" | "inside left" | "outside right" | "inside right" | "outside bottom" | "inside bottom" )
Determines where tick labels are drawn relative to the ticks. Left and right options are used when `orientation` is "h", top and bottom when `orientation` is "v".
ticklabelposition.title: Ticklabelposition

ticklabelstep.description:
integer greater than or equal to 1
Sets the spacing between tick labels as compared to the spacing between ticks. A value of 1 (default) means each tick gets a label. A value of 2 means shows every 2nd label. A larger value n means only every nth tick is labeled. `tick0` determines which labels are shown. Not implemented for axes with `type` "log" or "multicategory", or when `tickmode` is "array".
ticklabelstep.title: Ticklabelstep

ticklen.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the tick length (in px).
ticklen.title: Ticklen

tickmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "auto" | "linear" | "array" )
Sets the tick mode for this axis. If "auto", the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If "linear", the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` ("linear" is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If "array", the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. ("array" is the default value if `tickvals` is provided).
tickmode.title: Tickmode

ticks.description:
enumerated , one of ( "outside" | "inside" | "" )
Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If "", this axis' ticks are not drawn. If "outside" ("inside"), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.
ticks.title: Ticks

ticktext.description:
data array
Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to "array". Used with `tickvals`.
ticktext.title: Ticktext

tickvals.description:
data array
Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to "array". Used with `ticktext`.
tickvals.title: Tickvals

tickwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the tick width (in px).
tickwidth.title: Tickwidth

title.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

x.description:
number between or equal to -2 and 3
Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). Defaults to 1.02 when `orientation` is "v" and 0.5 when `orientation` is "h".
x.title: X

xanchor.description:
enumerated , one of ( "left" | "center" | "right" )
Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the "left", "center" or "right" of the color bar. Defaults to "left" when `orientation` is "v" and "center" when `orientation` is "h".
xanchor.title: Xanchor

xpad.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction.
xpad.title: Xpad

y.description:
number between or equal to -2 and 3
Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). Defaults to 0.5 when `orientation` is "v" and 1.02 when `orientation` is "h".
y.title: Y

yanchor.description:
enumerated , one of ( "top" | "middle" | "bottom" )
Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the "top", "middle" or "bottom" of the color bar. Defaults to "middle" when `orientation` is "v" and "bottom" when `orientation` is "h".
yanchor.title: Yanchor

ypad.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction.
ypad.title: Ypad

font.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute.

side.description:
enumerated , one of ( "right" | "top" | "bottom" )
Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Defaults to "top" when `orientation` if "v" and defaults to "right" when `orientation` if "h". Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute.
side.title: Side

text.description:
string
Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated.
text.title: Text

align.description:
enumerated or array of enumerateds , one of ( "left" | "right" | "auto" )
Sets the horizontal alignment of the text content within hover label box. Has an effect only if the hover label text spans more two or more lines
align.title: Align

bgcolor.description:
color or array of colors
Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace
bgcolor.title: Bgcolor

bordercolor.description:
color or array of colors
Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace.
bordercolor.title: Bordercolor

font.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets the font used in hover labels.

namelength.description:
integer or array of integers greater than or equal to -1
Sets the default length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for all traces. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis.
namelength.title: Namelength

font.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets this legend group's title font.

text.description:
string
Sets the title of the legend group.
text.title: Text

line.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

opacity.description:
number or array of numbers between or equal to 0 and 1
Sets the opacity of the locations.
opacity.title: Opacity

marker.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

autocolorscale.description:
boolean
Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.
autocolorscale.title: Autocolorscale

below.description:
string
Determines if the choropleth polygons will be inserted before the layer with the specified ID. By default, choroplethmapbox traces are placed above the water layers. If set to '', the layer will be inserted above every existing layer.
below.title: Below

coloraxis.description:
subplotid
Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are "coloraxis", "coloraxis2", "coloraxis3", etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.
coloraxis.title: Coloraxis

colorbar.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

colorscale.description:
colorscale
Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use `zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Blackbody,Bluered,Blues,Cividis,Earth,Electric,Greens,Greys,Hot,Jet,Picnic,Portland,Rainbow,RdBu,Reds,Viridis,YlGnBu,YlOrRd.
colorscale.title: Colorscale

customdata.description:
data array
Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, "scatter" traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements
customdata.title: Customdata

featureidkey.description:
string
Sets the key in GeoJSON features which is used as id to match the items included in the `locations` array. Support nested property, for example "properties.name".
featureidkey.title: Featureidkey

geojson.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Sets the GeoJSON data associated with this trace. It can be set as a valid GeoJSON object or as a URL string. Note that we only accept GeoJSONs of type "FeatureCollection" or "Feature" with geometries of type "Polygon" or "MultiPolygon".
geojson.title: Geojson

hoverinfo.description:
flaglist string. any combination of "location", "z", "text", "name" joined with a "+" or "all" or "none" or "skip".
Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.
hoverinfo.title: Hoverinfo

hoverlabel.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

hovertemplate.description:
string or array of strings
Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}" as well as %{xother}, {%_xother}, {%_xother_}, {%xother_}. When showing info for several points, "xother" will be added to those with different x positions from the first point. An underscore before or after "(x|y)other" will add a space on that side, only when this field is shown. Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variable `properties` Anything contained in tag `` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "{fullData.name}". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag ``.
hovertemplate.title: Hovertemplate

hovertext.description:
string or array of strings
Same as `text`.
hovertext.title: Hovertext

ids.description:
data array
Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.
ids.title: Ids

legendgroup.description:
string
Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.
legendgroup.title: Legendgroup

legendgrouptitle.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

legendrank.description:
number
Sets the legend rank for this trace. Items and groups with smaller ranks are presented on top/left side while with `"reversed" `legend.traceorder` they are on bottom/right side. The default legendrank is 1000, so that you can use ranks less than 1000 to place certain items before all unranked items, and ranks greater than 1000 to go after all unranked items.
legendrank.title: Legendrank

legendwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px or fraction) of the legend for this trace.
legendwidth.title: Legendwidth

locations.description:
data array
Sets which features found in "geojson" to plot using their feature `id` field.
locations.title: Locations

marker.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

showscale.description:

Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

exponentformat.description:
enumerated , one of ( "none" | "e" | "e" | "power" | "si" | "b" )
Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If "none", it appears as 1,000,000,000. If "e", 1e+9. If "E", 1E+9. If "power", 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If "SI", 1G. If "B", 1B.
exponentformat.title: Exponentformat

len.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends.
len.title: Len

lenmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "fraction" | "pixels" )
Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot "fraction" or in "pixels. Use `len` to set the value.
lenmode.title: Lenmode

minexponent.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is "SI" or "B".
minexponent.title: Minexponent

nticks.description:
integer greater than or equal to 0
Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to "auto".
nticks.title: Nticks

orientation.description:
enumerated , one of ( "h" | "v" )
Sets the orientation of the colorbar.
orientation.title: Orientation

outlinewidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.
outlinewidth.title: Outlinewidth

showexponent.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
If "all", all exponents are shown besides their significands. If "first", only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If "last", only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If "none", no exponents appear.
showexponent.title: Showexponent

showticklabels.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.
showticklabels.title: Showticklabels

showtickprefix.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
If "all", all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If "first", only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If "last", only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If "none", tick prefixes are hidden.
showtickprefix.title: Showtickprefix

showticksuffix.description:
enumerated , one of ( "all" | "first" | "last" | "none" )
Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.
showticksuffix.title: Showticksuffix

thickness.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels.
thickness.title: Thickness

thicknessmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "fraction" | "pixels" )
Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot "fraction" or in "pixels". Use `thickness` to set the value.
thicknessmode.title: Thicknessmode

tick0.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is "log", then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`="L" (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is "date", it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is "category", it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.
tick0.title: Tick0

tickangle.description:
angle
Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.
tickangle.title: Tickangle

tickfont.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets the color bar's tick label font

tickformat.description:
string
Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"
tickformat.title: Tickformat

tickformatstops.description: array of object where each object has one or more of the keys listed below.
tickformatstops.title: Tickformatstops

ticklabeloverflow.description:
enumerated , one of ( "allow" | "hide past div" | "hide past domain" )
Determines how we handle tick labels that would overflow either the graph div or the domain of the axis. The default value for inside tick labels is "hide past domain". In other cases the default is "hide past div".
ticklabeloverflow.title: Ticklabeloverflow

ticklabelposition.description:
enumerated , one of ( "outside" | "inside" | "outside top" | "inside top" | "outside left" | "inside left" | "outside right" | "inside right" | "outside bottom" | "inside bottom" )
Determines where tick labels are drawn relative to the ticks. Left and right options are used when `orientation` is "h", top and bottom when `orientation` is "v".
ticklabelposition.title: Ticklabelposition

ticklabelstep.description:
integer greater than or equal to 1
Sets the spacing between tick labels as compared to the spacing between ticks. A value of 1 (default) means each tick gets a label. A value of 2 means shows every 2nd label. A larger value n means only every nth tick is labeled. `tick0` determines which labels are shown. Not implemented for axes with `type` "log" or "multicategory", or when `tickmode` is "array".
ticklabelstep.title: Ticklabelstep

ticklen.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the tick length (in px).
ticklen.title: Ticklen

tickmode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "auto" | "linear" | "array" )
Sets the tick mode for this axis. If "auto", the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If "linear", the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` ("linear" is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If "array", the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. ("array" is the default value if `tickvals` is provided).
tickmode.title: Tickmode

ticks.description:
enumerated , one of ( "outside" | "inside" | "" )
Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If "", this axis' ticks are not drawn. If "outside" ("inside"), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.
ticks.title: Ticks

ticktext.description:
data array
Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to "array". Used with `tickvals`.
ticktext.title: Ticktext

tickvals.description:
data array
Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to "array". Used with `ticktext`.
tickvals.title: Tickvals

tickwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the tick width (in px).
tickwidth.title: Tickwidth

title.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

x.description:
number between or equal to -2 and 3
Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). Defaults to 1.02 when `orientation` is "v" and 0.5 when `orientation` is "h".
x.title: X

xanchor.description:
enumerated , one of ( "left" | "center" | "right" )
Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the "left", "center" or "right" of the color bar. Defaults to "left" when `orientation` is "v" and "center" when `orientation` is "h".
xanchor.title: Xanchor

xpad.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction.
xpad.title: Xpad

y.description:
number between or equal to -2 and 3
Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). Defaults to 0.5 when `orientation` is "v" and 1.02 when `orientation` is "h".
y.title: Y

yanchor.description:
enumerated , one of ( "top" | "middle" | "bottom" )
Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the "top", "middle" or "bottom" of the color bar. Defaults to "middle" when `orientation` is "v" and "bottom" when `orientation` is "h".
yanchor.title: Yanchor

ypad.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction.
ypad.title: Ypad

font.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute.

side.description:
enumerated , one of ( "right" | "top" | "bottom" )
Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Defaults to "top" when `orientation` if "v" and defaults to "right" when `orientation` if "h". Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute.
side.title: Side

text.description:
string
Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated.
text.title: Text

align.description:
enumerated or array of enumerateds , one of ( "left" | "right" | "auto" )
Sets the horizontal alignment of the text content within hover label box. Has an effect only if the hover label text spans more two or more lines
align.title: Align

bgcolor.description:
color or array of colors
Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace
bgcolor.title: Bgcolor

bordercolor.description:
color or array of colors
Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace.
bordercolor.title: Bordercolor

font.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets the font used in hover labels.

namelength.description:
integer or array of integers greater than or equal to -1
Sets the default length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for all traces. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis.
namelength.title: Namelength

font.description:
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
Sets this legend group's title font.

text.description:
string
Sets the title of the legend group.
text.title: Text

line.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

opacity.description:
number or array of numbers between or equal to 0 and 1
Sets the opacity of the locations.
opacity.title: Opacity

marker.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.
object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

radius.description:
number
Sets the circle radius (mapbox.layer.paint.circle-radius). Has an effect only when `type` is set to "circle".
radius.title: Radius

color.description:
color or array of colors
Sets the color for each cluster step.
color.title: Color

enabled.description:
boolean
Determines whether clustering is enabled or disabled.
enabled.title: Enabled

maxzoom.description:
number between or equal to 0 and 24
Sets the maximum zoom level. At zoom levels equal to or greater than this, points will never be clustered.
maxzoom.title: Maxzoom

opacity.description:
number or array of numbers between or equal to 0 and 1
Sets the marker opacity.
opacity.title: Opacity

size.description:
number or array of numbers greater than or equal to 0
Sets the size for each cluster step.
size.title: Size

step.description:
number or array of numbers greater than or equal to -1
Sets how many points it takes to create a cluster or advance to the next cluster step. Use this in conjunction with arrays for `size` and / or `color`. If an integer, steps start at multiples of this number. If an array, each step extends from the given value until one less than the next value.
step.title: Step

diverging.description:
colorscale
Sets the default diverging colorscale. Note that `autocolorscale` must be true for this attribute to work.
diverging.title: Diverging

sequential.description:
colorscale
Sets the default sequential colorscale for positive values. Note that `autocolorscale` must be true for this attribute to work.
sequential.title: Sequential

sequentialminus.description:
colorscale
Sets the default sequential colorscale for negative values. Note that `autocolorscale` must be true for this attribute to work.
sequentialminus.title: Sequentialminus

cmax.description:
number
Sets the upper bound of the color domain.
cmax.title: Cmax

cmin.description:
number
Sets the lower bound of the color domain.
cmin.title: Cmin

colorscale.description:
colorscale
Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use `cmin` and `cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Blackbody,Bluered,Blues,Cividis,Earth,Electric,Greens,Greys,Hot,Jet,Picnic,Portland,Rainbow,RdBu,Reds,Viridis,YlGnBu,YlOrRd.
colorscale.title: Colorscale

label.description:
string
The label of the links to color based on their concentration within a flow.
label.title: Label

name.description:
string
When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template.
name.title: Name

templateitemname.description:
string
Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.
templateitemname.title: Templateitemname

anchor.description:
enumerated , one of ( "tip" | "tail" | "cm" | "center" )
Sets the cones' anchor with respect to their x/y/z positions. Note that "cm" denote the cone's center of mass which corresponds to 1/4 from the tail to tip.
anchor.title: Anchor

autocolorscale.description:
boolean
Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.
autocolorscale.title: Autocolorscale

cauto.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here u/v/w norm) or the bounds set in `cmin` and `cmax` Defaults to `false` when `cmin` and `cmax` are set by the user.
cauto.title: Cauto

cmax.description:
number
Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as u/v/w norm and if set, `cmin` must be set as well.
cmax.title: Cmax

cmid.description:
number
Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `cmin` and/or `cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as u/v/w norm. Has no effect when `cauto` is `false`.
cmid.title: Cmid

cmin.description:
number
Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as u/v/w norm and if set, `cmax` must be set as well.
cmin.title: Cmin

coloraxis.description:
subplotid
Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are "coloraxis", "coloraxis2", "coloraxis3", etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.
coloraxis.title: Coloraxis

colorbar.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

colorscale.description:
colorscale
Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use `cmin` and `cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Blackbody,Bluered,Blues,Cividis,Earth,Electric,Greens,Greys,Hot,Jet,Picnic,Portland,Rainbow,RdBu,Reds,Viridis,YlGnBu,YlOrRd.
colorscale.title: Colorscale

customdata.description:
data array
Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, "scatter" traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements
customdata.title: Customdata

hoverinfo.description:
flaglist string. any combination of "x", "y", "z", "u", "v", "w", "norm", "text", "name" joined with a "+" or "all" or "none" or "skip".
Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.
hoverinfo.title: Hoverinfo

hoverlabel.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

hovertemplate.description:
string or array of strings
Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}" as well as %{xother}, {%_xother}, {%_xother_}, {%xother_}. When showing info for several points, "xother" will be added to those with different x positions from the first point. An underscore before or after "(x|y)other" will add a space on that side, only when this field is shown. Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variable `norm` Anything contained in tag `` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "{fullData.name}". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag ``.
hovertemplate.title: Hovertemplate

hovertext.description:
string or array of strings
Same as `text`.
hovertext.title: Hovertext

ids.description:
data array
Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.
ids.title: Ids

legendgroup.description:
string
Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.
legendgroup.title: Legendgroup

legendgrouptitle.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

legendrank.description:
number
Sets the legend rank for this trace. Items and groups with smaller ranks are presented on top/left side while with `"reversed" `legend.traceorder` they are on bottom/right side. The default legendrank is 1000, so that you can use ranks less than 1000 to place certain items before all unranked items, and ranks greater than 1000 to go after all unranked items.
legendrank.title: Legendrank

legendwidth.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Sets the width (in px or fraction) of the legend for this trace.
legendwidth.title: Legendwidth

lighting.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

lightposition.description: object containing one or more of the keys listed below.

meta.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.
meta.title: Meta

opacity.description:
number between or equal to 0 and 1
Sets the opacity of the surface. Please note that in the case of using high `opacity` values for example a value greater than or equal to 0.5 on two surfaces (and 0.25 with four surfaces), an overlay of multiple transparent surfaces may not perfectly be sorted in depth by the webgl API. This behavior may be improved in the near future and is subject to change.
opacity.title: Opacity

reversescale.description:
boolean
Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `cmax` will correspond to the first color.
reversescale.title: Reversescale

scene.description:
subplotid
Sets a reference between this trace's 3D coordinate system and a 3D scene. If "scene" (the default value), the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene`. If "scene2", the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene2`, and so on.
scene.title: Scene

showlegend.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.
showlegend.title: Showlegend

showscale.description:
boolean
Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.
showscale.title: Showscale

sizemode.description:
enumerated , one of ( "scaled" | "absolute" )
Determines whether `sizeref` is set as a "scaled" (i.e unitless) scalar (normalized by the max u/v/w norm in the vector field) or as "absolute" value (in the same units as the vector field).
sizemode.title: Sizemode

sizeref.description:
number greater than or equal to 0
Adjusts the cone size scaling. The size of the cones is determined by their u/v/w norm multiplied a factor and `sizeref`. This factor (computed internally) corresponds to the minimum "time" to travel across two successive x/y/z positions at the average velocity of those two successive positions. All cones in a given trace use the same factor. With `sizemode` set to "scaled", `sizeref` is unitless, its default value is "0.5" With `sizemode` set to "absolute", `sizeref` has the same units as the u/v/w vector field, its the default value is half the sample's maximum vector norm.
sizeref.title: Sizeref

text.description:
string or array of strings
Sets the text elements associated with the cones. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.
text.title: Text

u.description:
data array
Sets the x components of the vector field.
u.title: U

uhoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `u` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format.By default the values are formatted using generic number format.
uhoverformat.title: Uhoverformat

uirevision.description:
number or categorical coordinate string
Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.
uirevision.title: Uirevision

v.description:
data array
Sets the y components of the vector field.
v.title: V

vhoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `v` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format.By default the values are formatted using generic number format.
vhoverformat.title: Vhoverformat

visible.description:
enumerated , one of ( true | false | "legendonly" )
Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If "legendonly", the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).
visible.title: Visible

w.description:
data array
Sets the z components of the vector field.
w.title: W

whoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `w` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format.By default the values are formatted using generic number format.
whoverformat.title: Whoverformat

x.description:
data array
Sets the x coordinates of the vector field and of the displayed cones.
x.title: X

xhoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `x` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"By default the values are formatted using `xaxis.hoverformat`.
xhoverformat.title: Xhoverformat

y.description:
data array
Sets the y coordinates of the vector field and of the displayed cones.
y.title: Y

yhoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `y` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"By default the values are formatted using `yaxis.hoverformat`.
yhoverformat.title: Yhoverformat

z.description:
data array
Sets the z coordinates of the vector field and of the displayed cones.
z.title: Z

zhoverformat.description:
string
Sets the hover text formatting rulefor `z` using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/tree/v1.4.5#d3-format. And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/tree/v2.2.3#locale_format. We add two items to d3's date formatter: "%h" for half of the year as a decimal number as well as "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"By default the values are formatted using `zaxis.hoverformat`.
